title: Backing Up of TBird Profile Quickly Fills Flash Drive
content: I'm using a 128 GB flash drive to backup personal files on my Win 10 computer. I use "Backup Using File History". My flash drive seems to fill very quickly and upon investigation I see that the backup includes multiple, daily copies of my Gmail email inbox, sent mail, etc. I'm using TBird Ver. 102.6.1 and I have a gmail address. For example, after 1 week of daily backups, my gmail folder on the computer is 3.38 GB while the identical folder on the flash drive is 23.8 GB due to the multiple copies. I can see that each day I have a new set of gmail files while retaining all previous day's files. I'm not sure if this is a Windows issue, a gmail issue or a TBird issue. Any advice on how to correct this would be appreciated?
creator: neil.baron.1139

title: SSL expired on an old server, how can I find which account is still looking to it?
content:
I know exactly what the issue is, my shared host migrated my account to a different server months ago...and now, as of yesterday, the old server's SSL expired. I'm getting 4 "Legitimate banks will not ask you to do this" errors every time I start up Thunderbird, and then it keeps happening if I leave it on.

The problem is that I have carefully checked ALL of the 23 accounts that I have, and all of the 14 SMTP accounts. They all -- apparently -- are using the new server. It is mail.mysite.com everywhere I can find.

When I check the SSL for "mail.mysite.com" on a SSL checker, it is fine.

But the error message I keep getting in Thunderbird is for the OLD host, which is "boxABCD.myhostingproviderdomain.com:2080"

I tried calling them and explaining this and asking them to reissue the certificate, and they said my site already has its valid SSL (mail.mysite.com) and that's all they would do...they said it's something in my side.

My question is where can I find out which (if indeed there are any) email addresses (or could it be my Contacts list? My Calendar??) are still trying to search for the old SSL. I already tried clearing the cache, but it didn't help and shouldn't, since I don't think any certs are being cached.

Thank you so much for helping me figure this out.
creator: user239a

title: Install 32-bit TB over 64-bit TB and not lose anything?
content:
New Thunderbird user. I installed TB on Win10 computer. Working fine but I need to try the 32-bit version because I have a 32-bit ERP ("enterprise resource planning") app that writes emails to the default, MAPI-compliant email client on my computer. That used to be old Eudora, which accepted the emails. Now it is 64-bit TB which rejects them. I am hoping 32-bit TB will accept these MAPI emails emanating from my old ERP.

If I uninstall 64-bit TB and install 32-bit TB, will my emails, address book, filters and the rest appear, as before, in 32-bit TB? Reluctant to start this process until I know with certainty.

I thank you in advance. -Matt.
creator: matt178
